author: Vikki White
title: Top 10 active Alps breaks: Live the high life with a really cool holiday
text:
Can't stand the heat?
Then escape the searing sun of the Med for a high old time in the Alps.
Whether it's walking, cycling or sight-seeing, here are 10 cool options...
CULTURE IN CHAMONIX - From £485pp including flights
Sitting at the base of Mont Blanc, the Alps’ highest peaks, the French town is celebrating 150 years of mountaineering with events such as talks and drama. The pretty Chalet Hotel Sapiniere is close to the centre with fab hikes on its doorstep.
THE DEAL: Seven nights half-board at the three-star plus Sapiniere is from £485pp with Inghams including Gatwick flights on September 7 and transfers.
Walker;s paradise: Seefeld in Austria
CHILL OUT IN AUSTRIA - From £539pp including flights
Seefeld is a walker’s paradise surrounded by three mountain ranges. The Kaltschmid is one of the village’s premier hotels and is right in the centre. It has a spa, whirlpool and an indoor pool. There are free guided walks and a free kid’s club for children aged 3 to 12 in August.
THE DEAL: Seven nights half-board at the four-star Kaltschmid is from £539pp with Thomson Lakes, with Gatwick flights departing on August 29 and transfers.
Peaks perfect: Italian Alps
HIKING IN ITALY - From £798pp, flights extra
A week’s self-guided walking tour through the heart of The Dolomites makes a perfect summer break. This beautiful mountain range in the Italian Alps offers emerald lakes, green pastures, iconic peaks and historic hotels. Hiking highlights include San Lorenzo di Sebato, overlooked by twin castles Michelsburg and Sonnenburg and the awesome Three Peaks of Lavaredo.
THE DEAL: Seven-night Dolomites’ Three Peaks tour with Inntravel is from £798pp including half-board hotel stay, route maps and luggage transportation between hotels. Flights are extra.
Bled astray: Lake Bled, Slovenia
RELAX IN SLOVENIA - From £385pp including flights
Looking for somewhere new? Try the Julian Alps in North-West Slovenia. The four-star Hotel Lek, at the foot of a dramatic mountain range, is the ideal base for exploring the village of Kranjska Gora and gentle strolls up to Lake Jasna. Further afield, the stunning lakes of Bled and Bohinj are worth a visit. If you fancy a day of relaxation, the hotel has an indoor pool, spa and tennis courts.
THE DEAL: Seven nights on half board at the Hotel Lek costs from £385pp with Thomson Lakes, including flights from Gatwick departing on August 29 and transfers.
Train trip: Visit Lake Como
LAKE COMO VIA THE ALPS - From £702pp, flight and rail travel included
Let the train take the strain while you sit back and enjoy the breathtaking scenery of the Swiss Alps. Take the Eurostar and TGV to Zurich by pretty Lake Lucerne, where you spend a night before starting your rail journey to Lake Como through the dramatic Gotthard Pass. You get three nights in a four-star hotel at this stunning destination before travelling by rail to Milan for the return BA flight home.
THE DEAL: The four-night break with Railbookers costs from £702pp (reduced from £739pp).
On your bike:Cycling in the South Tyrol
CYCLE THROUGH SOUTH TYROL - From £940pp, flights extra
Leisurely cycling through dramatic landscapes can be found beneath South Tyrol’s snow-capped peaks. You’ll have two nights each in hotels in Bressanone, Trento and Bolzano. The route includes a cable car and a train ride.
THE DEAL: The Inntravel six-night Orchards & Vineyards cycling trip is from £940pp including B&B, two dinners, a travel pass, route notes, cycle hire and luggage transportation. Flights extra.
Style: Hotel Sevilla in Austria's Salzkammergut
FOUR-STAR HIKING - From £1,370pp including flights
If leisurely hiking aimed at discovering food, and culture appeals, try a week in Austria’s Salzkammergut. This guided walking experience is based in the lakeside village of Altaussee at the four-star Hotel Sevilla. Highlights include Loser Mountain, a boat ride to Kammersee and a coach and cable car trip to the Dachstein Ice Caves.
THE DEAL: An Adagio Austrian Lake District seven-night trip is from £1,370pp with Gatwick flights to Salzburg on August 30 or September 6 and transfers.
Trad about: In Bad Hindelang
BAVARIAN ADVENTURE - From £795pp, self-drive
This week in the Bavarian Alps is perfect for sporty families. You stay at a pretty hotel in the charming town of Bad Hindelang in Southern Germany, where you can try kayaking, zip wire, canyoning and a toboggan-like alpine coaster.
THE DEAL: Self-drive Activities Abroad trip is £795pp (£625 per child aged 8-11) for August departures, including seven nights half board, five lunches, all activities, tuition and equipment.
Maggiore marvel: The Castles of Cannero, islets with the ruins of ancient fortifications
ALL-INCLUSIVE LAKES - From £819pp with flights
See the beauty of Italian Lakes Como and Maggiore on this eight-day coach tour. Stay in a three-star hotel in Cadenabbia on the shores of Lake Como and enjoy a free daily boat transfer to Bellagio in summer. Optional excursions including a trip St Moritz, to ride the Bernina Region Railway, the highest in the Alps.
THE DEAL: The seven-night tour with Leger costs from £819pp including B&B, seven evening meals and six lunches, local drinks in the resort, return flights to Milan and transfers.
Swiss time: Travel in comfort by train through the heart of the Alps
SWITZERLAND BY TRAIN - £1,395pp including travel
Ride in comfort through the heart of the Alps on this fabulous seven-day rail tour, with stunning views guaranteed. Your journey starts on the Eurostar from London, via the TGV from Paris, to lakeside town Montreux, where you’ll spend your first evening. Three nights in Locarno, at the foot of the Alps, and three in Lucerne, which sits amid snow-capped mountains, follow. The unforgettable narrow-gauge Centovalli Railway forms part of your journey as does the William Tell Express, a quintessentially Swiss journey by lake-steamer and train into the heart of the Alps.
THE DEAL: Seven nights from £1,395pp in August with Planet Rail, including B&B and train travel, first class return from London to Locarno and Lucerne via Montreux. DailyMirror
